subject: Using JUnit and Struts: I need ActionForm Help
msgSnippet: Hello, I m currently writing tests for my web-applicaiton using JUnit and I came across a method I need to test that takes a DynaActionForm as a parameter.
messageBody:
Hello,
I'm currently writing tests for my web-applicaiton using JUnit and I
came across a method I need to test that takes a DynaActionForm as a
parameter. Problem is, I can't get ahold of the form with the beans
it needs inside of the method, from my JUnit test. Is there a way to
initialize a new ActionForm object from scratch using either an action
path as a string or a form-bean name?

-Chuck
